request_pathways.name: Facility-specific Request For Access And Authorization (AHCT 616)
System-wide Authorization for Release of Patient Health Information (ADV-800003A)

forms.document_type: Patient access and ROI authorization form

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Facility-specific PDF form with an explicit patient access checkbox, submitted via fax or mail to the local HIM department.

red_flags: Witness signature required for all requests — HIPAA does not require this for patient access
90-day maximum authorization expiration conflates patient access with third-party authorization
System-wide form cites Illinois law at a Texas facility
All-or-nothing sensitive information disclosure on facility form — no granular opt-out for mental health, substance abuse, or HIV/AIDS
bright_spots: Explicit patient access checkbox as the first option on the facility form
Broad catch-all category for 'any other personally identifiable information used to make medical decisions'
Local facility phone and fax numbers on facility form
Secure email delivery option on system-wide form
Non-conditioning statement present on both forms

findability.rationale: Level 4: Both forms found on first web search with no barriers; direct CDN links without login walls or bot blocking, though no contextual landing page guides patients to the correct form.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 2: Primarily a paper workflow — both forms have zero fillable fields requiring print-and-handwrite completion, though fax submission is available, preventing a score of 1.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Adequate 2-page form with logical first-page organization, but page 2 is a dense legal text block without visual separation; no standalone instructions; two overlapping forms create confusion.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: The facility form includes an explicit patient access checkbox and differentiates self-access from third-party release, but conflates patient access with authorization, requires a witness, and the two-form landscape means patients must figure out which applies.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Witness requirement and 90-day authorization cap go beyond HIPAA requirements for patient access; system form cites wrong state law; non-conditioning statement and revocation rights are properly included.

overall.summary: AdventHealth Central Texas offers a findable facility-specific form with genuine patient access language, but zero fillable fields, a witness requirement, and a confusing two-form landscape undermine the experience.
